alert.note: Alert for La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 10:13PM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at La Salle affecting Bureau, La Salle and Putnam Counties. Illinois River at Ottawa affecting La Salle County. For the Illinois River (Upper)...including Ottawa, La Salle...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is expected due to a combination of elevated river levels and river ice. * WHERE...Illinois River from Heritage Harbor east of Ottawa downstream to Starved Rock Lock and Dam, including the Ottawa gauge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying overbank areas near Starved Rock State Park, Naplate, and Ottawa is likely. Flooding of park areas and low-lying roadways is possible in Ottawa, and flooding of trails is possible at Starved Rock State Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - River gauges and satellite imagery indicate an ice jam upstream of Starved Rock Lock and Dam. At 9:30 PM CST Tuesday the stage at the Ottawa river gauge was 463.0 feet. - Forecast...River levels are expected to remain near flood stage for the next several days. Water level fluctuations remain possible if ice shifts or breaks along the river. - Flood stage is 463.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: An ice jam is affecting water levels in this area. River forecasts during ice jams are less certain due to many complicated factors. Significant river ice cover can cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. River ice may also cause gauge observations to be inaccurate. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 415 PM CST.
